knimeNode.name: JavaScript Tag Cloud

intro.p: A tag cloud view using JavaScript libraries. The view can be accessed either via the "interactive view" action on the executed node or in KNIME Server web portal page.

The implementation is based on the popular JavaScript library D3 and the layout extension by Jason Davies, which is inspired by the popular Java based Wordle. See the appropriate links for more details.

The configuration of the node lets you choose the size of a sample to display and to enable certain controls, which are then available in the view. This includes the ability to choose different font sizes or the possibility to set a title. Enabling or disabling these controls via the configuration dialog might not seem useful at first glance but has benefits when used in a web portal/wizard execution where the end user has no access to the workflow itself.
Since missing values cannot be displayed in the view, they will be omitted with a corresponding warning message.
Additionally a static SVG image can be rendered, which is then made available at the image output port.

tab.name: Options
tab.description: This tab contains all general options for controlling the generation and output of the view.
tab.option: Use this numerical value to restrict the number of tags used for this visualization. This number takes into account aggregation settings and the largest tags by size are retained. A warning message can be displayed if the number of tags in the input table exceeds this value.
If checked, warning messages will be displayed in the view when they occur. This could contain information about missing values, exceeding word count, limited layout space, etc.

Missing values in the selected word or size column lead to the omission of the corresponding row. If this option is checked and missing values are encountered a warning is issued, the rows are silently ignored otherwise.
If an image is supposed to be rendered during execute for the image outport. Disable this option if image is not needed or creation is too time consuming. In this case the outport will be disabled.
The title of the visualization shown above the generated tag cloud. If left blank, no title will be shown.
The subtitle of the visualization shown above the generated tag cloud. If left blank, no subtitle will be shown.
Defines the column that contains the string values for the tags to display. The node supports string and term cells.

Setting this option aggregates tags from the input table if the tag value is the same. The size of the resulting tag is determined as the sum of all values in the selected size column or property. Use this option in conjunction with 'Ignore term tags' when selecting a tag column of type 'term'.
If selected the term tags are ignored. So two terms are equal, when their words are equal. The new value of the term will be the sum over all terms, which contain the same words.
Defines the column that contains the numerical size values for the tags to display. This can be also set to '<none>', in which case the size property for the individual row is used.
In case no size column is used the size property for each row is extracted as a size measure for the tags.
Static width of view and generated image. If 'resize view to fill window' is used, this value has no effect.
Static height of view and generated image. If 'resize view to fill window' is used, this value has no effect.
Setting this option resizes the view and image to the available area of the window. If disabled the view size is static according to the set width and height.
Displays a button enabling full screen mode.

tab.name: Display
tab.description: This tab contains specific display settings which control the font and layout of the tags in the view.
tab.option: A font family string, which is used to render the tags. Values can be comma separated for fallback declaration. E.g. 'Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif'.

The font sizes are calculated as an interpolation between specified minimum and maximum font size. There is four interpolation methods to choose from:
linear
logarithmic
square root
exponential
Depending on the size distribution in the data and the desired layout one or another interpolation method might be more fitting.

Specification for the minimum and maximum font size of the rendered tags. Please note that if the values are too large for all words to fit in the designated view area, tags might be omitted from the layout or overlap. In this case a warning is displayed in the view.
Check to use a bold variant of the selected font family for display.

If checked the color property for each tag is extracted from the input table. Use a 'Color Manager' to assign colors to the data in advance. If not checked colors are randomly drawn from a default color scale.

Defines the type of spiral used to position the tags. There is two types to choose from:
archimedean
rectangular

Numerical value for the number of orientations which are assigned randomly to tags. The rotation angles are calculated according to the specified start and end angle with the number of orientations taken into account. E.g. to create a strict perpendicular layout set the number to 2, with the start angle at -90° and the end angle at 0°. By default there is 5 orientations between -60° and +60°, which results in the following set of orientations: [-60°, -30°, 0°, +30° +60°].
Numerical values for start and end angle of orientations. The values need to be in the range from -90° to +90°. See 'number of orientations' for more details.

Displays a button to refresh the tag cloud layout with the current settings. As the orientation and placement of tags have a random component, the layout will look different every time. To achieve a desired look or placement of certain key tags, etc. this button can be pressed multiple times. When the view's value is applied the last layout is remembered for image creation and subsequent opening of the view.
If checked all view animations will be disabled.

tab.name: Interactivity
tab.description: This tab contains all settings which control the interactive menu displayable in the view, as well as selection and filter settings.
tab.option: Enables or disables all view menu controls.
Renders a text input field to change the visualization's title in the view.
Renders a text input field to change the visualization's subtitle in the view.
Renders a selection box to change the interpolation method for font sizes in the view.
Renders numerical inputs to change minimum and maximum font sizes in the view.
Renders a selection box to change the spiral type in the view.
Renders numerical input field to change the number of orientations used for tag rotation in the view.
Renders numerical inputs to change the start and end angles used for word rotation in the view.

If checked tags are selectable by clicking in the view. Multiple selection can be done by holding down the Ctrl-Key (Cmd-Key on Mac). The selection, when applied, will be represented in the output table as a new boolean column.
Selected words are indicated by an added outline in the view. Select a color that does not interfere with the colors applied to the tags themselves.
If checked, notifies other interactive views when user changes the selection in the current view. See also "Subscribe to selection events".
If checked, the view reacts on notifications from other interactive views that the selection has been changed. See also "Publish selection events".
If checked, only tags which are selected are displayed.
If checked, a checkbox to switch on and off the mode of displaying only selected tags is rendered in the view.
The name of the boolean column containing the selection.
If checked, the view reacts when applied filters have been changed.

knimeNode.interactiveView: Displays the selected strings in a tag cloud.

ports.inPort: Input table containing tags to display.
ports.outPort: Generated SVG image of tag cloud visualization.

Data table containing the input data appended with a column, that represents the selection made in the tag cloud view. Selected tags are denoted by a 'true' value and unselected tags be a 'false' value respectively. Rows with tags that were not shown in the view, for example because of missing values or exceeding tag limit will be denoted with a missing value.
